•  clamping the umbilical cord only after pulsation has stopped;18  
•  initiation of breastfeeding within the first hour of birth, along with skin-to-skin contact;
•  so-called on-demand breastfeeding;
•  exclusive breastfeeding from birth until six months of age; and
•   continued breastfeeding up to two years of age; along with timely introduction of appropriate 
complementary feeding at six months of age.
